content:
advertisement

She told Penn State Police that she was sexually assaulted when she was  years old and visiting Penn State   years ago PERIOD

Nearly three decades later a woman came forward as one of many women who experts say wait to report sexual assaults PERIOD

 said Anne Ard director of the Centre County Womens Resource Center CCWRC PERIOD 

Penn State Police said the incident which was reported last Monday took place in February  in a campus residence hall PERIOD The case is awaiting further legal interpretation from Centre County District Attorney Stacy Parks Miller PERIOD

Peggy Lorah director of the Center for Women Students said its very common for someone to wait weeks or months to report a sexual assault to friends family or authorities PERIOD Few victims report it immediately following the incident she said PERIOD

 Lorah said PERIOD

Many victims feel ashamed and responsible for the attack and some are worried no one will believe them PERIOD And because  percent of people who report sexual assaults in the county know their assailant they are afraid others wont see it as sexual assault Lorah said PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Ard said it is important for people not to be so trusting of others in order to prevent these incidents PERIOD The CCWRC offers sexual assault services to more than  men women and children from Centre County annually PERIOD More than  percent of all those victims are women PERIOD

Penn State students make up  percent of those individuals Ard said PERIOD

CCWRC has a number of programs to help prevent sexual assaults from happening PERIOD Starting as early as preschool and elementary school these programs are designed  Ard said PERIOD

Christian Ragland University Park Undergraduate Association UPUA student life and diversity chairman said having this assault reported to police underlines the importance of the student governments campaign against sexual violence PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

UPUA is currently working with different groups to create a policy for students regarding sexual assault PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

As for now Penn State Police Deputy Director Tyrone Parham said police will continue working with Parks Miller and investigating the assault
